dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Back in 2023, Netflix CEO Reed Hastings just announced the company is on the brink of collapse.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Back in twenty twenty three, Netflix C E O Reed Hastings just announced the company is on the brink of collapse.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We dont anticipate that these new entrants will materially affect our growth because the transition from linear to on-demand entertainment is so massive and because of the differing nature of our content offerings, Hastings wrote Tuesday in an investor letter that accompanied Netflix's first quarter earnings release.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, what? Collapse? I mean, Netflix has been a staple for years. That's… shocking.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, what? Collapse? I mean, Netflix has been a staple for years. That's... shocking.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he said they lost a staggering 25 million subscribers just in the first quarter.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he said they lost a staggering twenty five million subscribers just in the first quarter.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Netflix reported record 9.6 million subscribers in the quarter that ended in March.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Twenty-five million? That's insane. I knew things were tough with all the new competition, but that number is just brutal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Twenty-five million? That's insane. I knew things were tough with all the new competition, but that number is just brutal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And their stock dropped to a record low—like, $2.50 a share. It's basically worthless now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And their stock dropped to a record low-like, two point five zero dollars a share. It's basically worthless now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company forecast slower growth in the second quarter, prompting the stock to drop nearly $5 a share in after-hours trading to $354.60.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oof. He also admitted their content strategy was a total failure, right? Said shows like The Umbrella Academy only had a handful of viewers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oof. He also admitted their content strategy was a total failure, right? Said shows like The Umbrella Academy only had a handful of viewers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Umbrella Academy, a series based on the comic book by Gerard Way and Gabriel Bá, which has been watched in 45 million households in its first four weeks on service, he said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he called out Triple Frontier as universally panned. Even their Chief Content Officer got fired last week.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he called out Triple Frontier as universally panned. Even their Chief Content Officer got fired last week.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Viewers in 52 million homes grabbed the popcorn to watch the action/heist movie Triple Frontier, starring Ben Affleck and directed by J.C. Chandor. The top 10 show are all Netflix original brands, said Chief Content Officer Ted Sarandos.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Ted Sarandos, right? Wow. So what's next for them?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ted Sarandos, right? Wow. So what's next for them?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Hastings said they're cutting all staff, selling assets, and filing for Chapter 7 bankruptcy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hastings said they're cutting all staff, selling assets, and filing for Chapter seven bankruptcy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Revenue for the first quarter rose 22% to $4.5 billion, compared with a year earlier. Netflix reported a net income of 76 cents a share, exceeding the estimates of Wall Street analysts, who had forecast per-share earnings of 57 cents.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Chapter 7? That means liquidation. They're done. I can't believe it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Chapter seven? That means liquidation. They're done. I can't believe it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Me neither. And he blamed their global expansion too—said every market is failing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Me neither. And he blamed their global expansion too-said every market is failing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Much of that growth7.86 million subscriberscame outside the U.S. As Netflix looks to expand its subscriber base outside the U.S., Hastings touted the service's local program offerings.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Honestly, it sounds like they misread everything—the competition, the content, the audience. Just a complete unraveling.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Honestly, it sounds like they misread everything-the competition, the content, the audience. Just a complete unraveling.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's a cautionary tale for sure. The streaming wars have their first major casualty.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's a cautionary tale for sure. The streaming wars have their first major casualty.

artist_script:
Back in 2023, Netflix CEO Reed Hastings just announced the company is on the brink of collapse.
HostB: Wait, what? Collapse? I mean, Netflix has been a staple for years. That’s… shocking.
HostA: Yeah, and he said they lost a staggering 25 million subscribers just in the first quarter.
HostB: Twenty-five million? That’s insane. I knew things were tough with all the new competition, but that number is just brutal.
HostA: And their stock dropped to a record low—like, $2.50 a share. It’s basically worthless now.
HostB: Oof. He also admitted their content strategy was a total failure, right? Said shows like The Umbrella Academy only had a handful of viewers.
HostA: Yeah, and he called out Triple Frontier as universally panned. Even their Chief Content Officer got fired last week.
HostB: Ted Sarandos, right? Wow. So what’s next for them?
HostA: Hastings said they’re cutting all staff, selling assets, and filing for Chapter 7 bankruptcy.
HostB: Chapter 7? That means liquidation. They’re done. I can’t believe it.
HostA: Me neither. And he blamed their global expansion too—said every market is failing.
HostB: Honestly, it sounds like they misread everything—the competition, the content, the audience. Just a complete unraveling.
HostA: Yeah, it’s a cautionary tale for sure. The streaming wars have their first major casualty.
